content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers:
The structure consists of 9 blocks arranged in 6 distinct layers from bottom to top:
1. Bottom layer: Yellow horizontal rectangular base
2. Second layer: Red block with a circular hole
3. Third layer: Yellow horizontal rectangular base (identical to first layer)
4. Fourth layer: Two blocks side by side - blue cube (left) and red cube (right)
5. Fifth layer: Green horizontal rectangular block
6. Top layer: Two orange triangular roof pieces forming a peaked roof

## Spatial Relationships:
- The structure builds vertically with yellow bases at the bottom and third layers
- The red block with circular hole sits between the yellow bases
- Two cubes (blue and red) sit side by side on the upper yellow base
- The green rectangular block spans across both cubes
- Two triangular orange roof pieces form the peaked roof on top

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the analysis, these blocks are needed:
- Block #11: Yellow horizontal rectangular base (used twice)
- Block #1: Red block with circular hole
- Block #4: Blue cube
- Block #5: Red cube
- Block #7: Green horizontal rectangular block
- Block #14: Orange triangular piece (front roof piece)
- Block #15: Orange triangular piece (back roof piece)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 11
    Step2: Move block with index 1
    Step3: Move block with index 11
    Step4: Move block with index 4
    Step5: Move block with index 5
    Step6: Move block with index 7
    Step7: Move block with index 14
    Step8: Move block with index 15
}
```

This assembly sequence builds the structure from the ground up, starting with the foundation and working upward to the roof.
